column2: MONTANA DMV DRIVING TEST
column6: MT

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column6: check your rearview mirror.
column8: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 2. Signs and markings requiring that you obey the indicated instruction are known as _____ signs.
column6: information
column8: guide
column10: warning

column2: 3. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.
column6: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.
column8: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.
column10: accelerate to the speed of traffic.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column6: Keep to the left.
column8: Divided highway ends.
column10: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 5. You are coming to an intersection and have a green light. Pedestrians are crossing against the red. You should:
column4: speed up and pass in front of the pedestrians.
column6: stop to let pedestrians cross safely.
column8: honk your horn.
column10: claim your right-of-way and proceed with caution.

column2: 6. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.
column6: Turn on your emergency lights.
column8: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 7. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column6: The driver on the left.
column8: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.
column10: The last driver to reach the intersection.

column2: 8. Aggressive drivers:
column6: are high risk drivers.
column8: tailgate other vehicles and make improper lane changes.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 9. Before turning, you should:
column6: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.
column8: increase your speed.
column10: change lanes.

column2: 10. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.
column8: Use your ABS System.
column10: Shift to a lower gear.

column2: 11. Speed limit signs are:
column6: service signs
column8: regulation signs (regulatory signs)
column10: warning signs

column2: 12. If one of your tires blows out, you should:
column4: apply your brakes gently and steer smoothly where you want to go.
column6: hold the steering wheel tightly, slowly take your foot off the gas pedal and steer smoothly where you want to go.
column8: apply your brakes immediately.
column10: pump your brakes and steer where you want to go.

column2: 13. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
14. This road sign means:
column6: Pavement is narrowing
column8: Low clearance
column10: Narrow bridge ahead

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column6: A road joins from the left
column8: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column10: Sharp right turn

column2: 16. A yellow arrow used to control turns from a specific traffic lane:
column4: means the same as a circular yellow light for the lane of traffic indicated by the arrow.
column6: is warning the traffic a green arrow is about to be shown.
column8: is never used as a traffic signal.
column10: means that you may go in the direction indicated by the arrow.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column6: Warning, slippery when wet
column8: Keep left
column10: Left curve ahead

column2: 18. What does this sign indicate?
column6: Train intersection
column8: Parallel railroad crossing (side road)
column10: Low ground clearance railroad crossing

column2: 19. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.
column6: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column8: increase your speed immediately.
column10: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.

column2: 20. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column6: AFTER you move.
column8: if it’s raining.
column10: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 21. ________ is the only effective way to reduce your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC).
column6: Taking a cold shower
column8: Eating food
column10: Drinking coffee

column2: 22. If a vehicle is approaching with high beams, drivers should look __________ until the vehicle passes.
column4: to the left of the road
column6: to the right of the road
column8: at the center of the road
column10: straight ahead

column2: 23. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column6: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column8: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column10: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

column2: 24. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column8: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column10: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column6: You may proceed only if the way is clear
column8: You are about to enter a one-way street the wrong way
column10: Do not pass

column2: 26. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.
column6: are easier for the driver to operate.
column8: take longer than cars to stop.
column10: require more space for turning movements.

column2: 27. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: be prepared to stop before the intersection.
column6: speed up to beat the red light.
column8: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.
column10: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.

column2: 28. Drivers must yield to pedestrians:
column4: only if the pedestrian is on the same side of the road.
column6: only if the pedestrian is in a crosswalk.
column8: even when the pedestrian crosses the street without looking both ways.
column10: if the pedestrian signals to the driver that the driver must stop.

column2: 29. Do not pass:
column6: when approaching intersections.
column8: when school bus lights are flashing.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 30. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.
column6: Never.
column8: in school zones.
column10: from a one-way street into a one-way street.

column2: 31. When changing lanes, __________ to be sure no one is in the "blind spot".
column6: slow down gradually
column8: check your right mirror
column10: check your left mirror

column2: 32. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.
column6: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.
column8: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column10: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.

column2: 33. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: once you see the toll booth.
column6: before moving into the exit lane.
column8: when you first see the exit sign.
column10: once you have moved into the exit lane.

column2: 31. When changing lanes, __________ to be sure no one is in the "blind spot".
column6: slow down gradually
column8: check your right mirror
column10: check your left mirror

column2: 32. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.
column6: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.
column8: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column10: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.

column2: 33. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: once you see the toll booth.
column6: before moving into the exit lane.
column8: when you first see the exit sign.
column10: once you have moved into the exit lane.
